weka.classifiers.collective

Class CollectiveRandomizableSingleClassifierEnhancer

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.classifiers.AbstractClassifier
      • weka.classifiers.SingleClassifierEnhancer
        • weka.classifiers.RandomizableSingleClassifierEnhancer
          • weka.classifiers.collective.CollectiveRandomizableSingleClassifierEnhancer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Classifier, CollectiveClassifier, AdditionalMeasureProducer, CapabilitiesHandler, OptionHandler, Randomizable, RevisionHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CollectiveEM, CollectiveWrapper, FilteredCollectiveClassifier, SimpleCollective, YATSI

    public abstract class CollectiveRandomizableSingleClassifierEnhancer
extends RandomizableSingleClassifierEnhancer
implements CollectiveClassifier, AdditionalMeasureProducer
    Abstract classifier for a randomizable collective classifer with a single base classifier.
    Version:
    $Revision: 2019 $
    Author:
    Fracpete (fracpete at waikato dot ac dot nz)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setOptions

        public void setOptions(java.lang.String[] options)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses a given list of options. Valid options are:

        -folds folds
        the number of folds for splitting the training set into train and test set. the first fold is always the training set. With '-V' you can invert this, i.e., instead of 20/80 for 5 folds you'll get 80/20. (default 5)

        -V
        inverts the fold selection, i.e., instead of using the first fold for the training set it is used for test set and the remaining folds for training.

        -verbose
        whether to output some more information during improving the classifier.

        -insight
        whether to use the labels of the original test set to output more statistics.

        Options after -- are passed to the designated classifier.

        Specified by:
        setOptions in interface OptionHandler
        Overrides:
        setOptions in class RandomizableSingleClassifierEnhancer
        Parameters:
        options - the list of options as an array of strings
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an option is not supported

      • setSplitFolds

        public void setSplitFolds(int value)
        Set the percentage for splitting the train set into train and test set. Use 0 for no splitting, which results in test = train.
        Specified by:
        setSplitFolds in interface CollectiveClassifier
        Parameters:
        value - the split percentage (1/splitFolds*100)

      • distributionForInstance

        public double[] distributionForInstance(Instance instance)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Predicts the class memberships for a given instance. If an instance is unclassified, the returned array elements must be all zero. If the class is numeric, the array must consist of only one element, which contains the predicted value. Note that a classifier MUST implement either this or classifyInstance().
        Note: if a derived class should override this method, make sure it calls checkBuiltStatus().
        Specified by:
        distributionForInstance in interface Classifier
        Overrides:
        distributionForInstance in class AbstractClassifier
        Parameters:
        instance - the instance to be classified
        Returns:
        an array containing the estimated membership probabilities of the test instance in each class or the numeric prediction
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if distribution could not be computed successfully
        See Also:
        checkBuiltStatus()

        resets the classifier

      • buildClassifier

        public void buildClassifier(Instances training)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Method for building this classifier. Since the collective classifiers also need the test set, we only store here the training set.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
